title: An Examination of the Notion of Moral Good and Evil
sourceDesc: John Clarke’s [Examination of the Notion of Moral Good and Evil] is an attack on William Wollaston’s [Religion of Nature Delineated](https://englishphilosophy.org/texts/wollaston/rnd). The text here derives from Stanley Tweyman’s edition of the latter (Delmar, New York: Scholars’ Facsimiles and Reprints), which includes Clarke’s criticism, as well as an anonymous defence of Wollaston written in response to Clarke (also published in 1725; Wollaston himself died in 1724).
